message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY

This paper is about detecting primary user emulation (PUE) attacks in cognitive radio networks (CRNs) using recurrent neural networks (RNNs). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), which covers topics related to computer networks and communication systems. The paper also discusses security issues in CRNs, which suggests cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as another likely category. The use of RNNs for PUE attack detection involves machine learning techniques, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper proposes an advanced version of the algorithm that is more efficient on processing time series with long term memory, which could be related to cs.SY (Systems and Control).
